definition-item.definition-title: CHARACTERISTIC FEATURES OF FOOTWEAR; PARTS OF FOOTWEAR

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Footwear, shoes, shoe components, assembling of these components, shape, and use of the shoes.

definition-item.definition-title: Footwear characterised by the material

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
General features of the material the footwear presents, either in the sole or in the upper.
Basically when it does not really matter where in the upper or in the sole the feature has to be (e.g. the use of a transparent material, to cover a logo while still displaying it).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Producing particular articles from plastic, footwear
Macromolecular compounds, e.g. polyethylene or polypropylene copolymers
Macromolecular compounds, e.g. polyurethane or silicones
Manufacture of polymeric films or sheets
Production of macromolecular porous or cellular articles
Impregnation or coating of paper; Special paper

definition-item.definition-title: made of wood, cork, card-board, paper or like fibrous material

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: made of metal

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: made of rubber

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Footwear made from natural or synthetic rubber material.

definition-item.definition-title: made of plastics (A43B1/028 takes precedence)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Footwear made from synthetic polymers, e.g. polyethylene, polyurethane or artificial leathers.
Synthetic rubber should be classified in A43B1/10.
This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Footwear made of synthetic or artificial fibres

definition-item.definition-title: Footwear characterised by the shape or the use

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
General or special shape of the footwear, or a special use.

Examples of what will found here are footwear equipped with electronic devices, adjustable in length, slippers with all kind of straps, shoes to help or protect a person (e.g. military person) walking on landmines (by absorbing energy, deflecting shock wave, or limit the pressure of the person on the ground by increasing the ground contact surface of the sole, avoiding by such to trigger the landmine to activate).
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Footwear for all kind of sport
Features concerning a support or resilient pad

definition-item.definition-title: Boots covering the lower leg

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Low shoes {, e.g. comprising only a front strap}; Slippers

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Sandals; Strap guides thereon

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Sandals are an open type of footwear, consisting of a sole held to the wearer's foot by straps going over the instep and around the ankle.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Overshoes

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Collapsible or convertible

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: adjustable as to length or size

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Adjustable ski boots or similar boots

definition-item.definition-title: with electrical or electronic arrangements

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Footwear for sporting purposes (non-skid devices, e.g. ice-spurs or studs for football shoes, A43C15/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Footwear especially adapted for the practice of sport.
For example ski boots, neoprene footwear for use in the water, golf shoes.
This place does not cover:
If the document concerns the stud for a football shoe, and does not bring any information about the shoe, it does not have to be classified in A43B5/02.

definition-item.definition-title: {for horse riding}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: {Linings, paddings or insertions; Inner boots}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Shoe-shaped inserts; Inserts covering the instep

definition-item.definition-title: Footwear with health or hygienic arrangements

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Footwear with health (protection against injuries, walking aid for injured people, people with diseases) or hygienic arrangements.
Examples: ventilation systems for footwear, waterproof arrangements, support pads, resilient pads, located under strategic bones/regions of the foot.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: with heating arrangements (with electric heating arrangements A43B3/35)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Heating or cooling appliances for medical or therapeutic treatment of the foot

definition-item.definition-title: ventilated

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Skating boots with ventilation means in the sole
Skating boots with ventilation means in the upper

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: with pads or holes on one or more locations, or having an anatomical or curved form

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Any pad, or resilient cushion, recess filled with resilient part.
A43B7/1415 and subgroups will locate geographically the pad under the foot.
A43B7/1475 and subgroups will specify the type of pad/cushion.
It is important to give a class in both subgroups.

Additional information can be given by attributing a class in A43B17/00 if the document concerns an insole to be inserted, in A43B13/18 or A43B13/20 if it concerns the midsole/the sole (even if in the heel, like Nike Air).

definition-item.definition-title: with removable pads to allow custom fit

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Foot-supporting parts where a custom fit is provided for by at least one pad which can be removed or replaced with another pad.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group:
The foot-supporting part includes fasteners to provide for the addition and removal of a support insert.
Removal of a pad but replacing it in another available position should be classified in A43B7/1469. This is considered an adjustable feature since the pad is only removed so that it can be relocated.

Example - Pads (102) and (105) should be considered adjustable since they are removed but replaced in a different configuration. Pad (104) should be considered removable since it is either added or removed and cannot be placed in another position. If the foot-supporting part also supports the foot with pads (102) and (105) removed, then classification in A43B7/1463 is also proper.

definition-item.definition-title: with adjustable pads to allow custom fit

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Foot-supporting parts where a custom fit is provided for by adjustment of at least one pad.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group:
The footwear below includes an air bladder at the arch where the pressure of the bladder is adjustable.

definition-item.definition-title: adjustable by screws or threads

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Foot-supporting parts where at least one pad is adjusted by turning a screw or movement along a threaded piece.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group:
The footwear below includes a pad which can be adjusted by turning a screw.

definition-item.definition-title: adjustable by resilient members, e.g. springs

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Foot-supporting parts where at least one pad is adjustable through the elastic deformation of a resilient member.

definition-item.definition-title: adjustable by shims

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Foot-supporting parts where at least one pad is adjustable by adding and removing shims.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group:
Foot-supporting part with pad (322) where adjustment is made by inserting one or more shims (301, 302, 303).

definition-item.definition-title: adjustable by selectively fastening or securing into multiple available positions

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Foot-supporting parts where a custom fit is provided for by pads which can be positioned into multiple positions.
Illustrative example of subject matter classified in this group:
The foot-supporting part includes pads (102) and (105) which can be secured across multiple positions.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Footwear with removable pads to allow custom fit

definition-item.definition-title: with fixed flat-foot insertions, metatarsal supports, ankle flaps or the like

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Elevating, i.e. height increasing (with elevated heel parts inside A43B7/16; lengthening pieces for natural legs A61F3/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Footwear characterised by the assembling of the individual parts

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Assembling an upper to a sole, e.g. by stitching, gluing.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Assembling different parts of the upper together
Assembling of an upper to a sole by moulding/vulcanising

section-body.paragraph-text: A43B9/16, A43B9/18, A43B9/20 are not really used anymore. B29D35/06 and B29D35/10 are more appropriate.

definition-item.definition-title: Footwear with soles moulded on to uppers or welded on to uppers without adhesive

section-body.paragraph-text: not used: B29D35/10 (having preformed soles or heels joined on the preformed uppers using moulding technique, e.g. by feeding or injecting material between the parts to be joined.

definition-item.definition-title: moulded

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Footwear having soles or heels formed and joined on to preformed uppers using a moulding technique, e.g. by injection moulding, pressing and vulcanising
Footwear having preformed soles or heels joined on to preformed uppers using a moulding technique, e.g. by feeding or injecting plastics material between the parts to be joined

section-body.paragraph-text: Not used, use instead B29D35/06 and B29D35/10.

definition-item.definition-title: welded

section-body.paragraph-text: Not used: B29D35/10: having preformed soles or heels joined on to preformed uppers using a moulding technique, e.g. by feeding or injecting plastics material between the parts to be joined.

definition-item.definition-title: Footwear with arrangements to facilitate putting-on or removing, e.g. with straps

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Any arrangement to help putting-on of the shoes. It can be the shape, that makes it easier to put the foot inside the shoe, or built-in shoe horns which have a dedicated sub-group.

definition-item.definition-title: Soles; Sole-and-heel integral units

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Soles, midsoles and built-in insoles.
Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Skating boots characterised by the sole

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Insoles for insertion, e.g. footbeds or inlays, for attachment to the shoe after the upper has been joined

definition-item.definition-title: characterised by the material

section-body.paragraph-text: If the material can be component of the sole, of a part of it or a layer of it, a class in A43B13/02 and subgroups has to be assigned. On top of that, in case of multilayer, A43B13/12 and subgroup defines where the material is expected to be found.

If the insole is multilayered, a class in A43B13/386 has to be attributed. If the material concerns a part of the sole/layer (e.g. the front, the middle part, the heel, and not the rest, the sole/layer is call "pieced" A43B13/16 has to be attributed (A43B13/38 in case of a pieced insole).

definition-item.definition-title: {Soles with several layers of the same material}

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Soles with several layers of different materials

definition-item.definition-title: Soles made slip-preventing or wear-resisting, e.g. by impregnation or spreading a wear-resisting layer

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:

Sole made anti skid, either by impregnation, either by antiskid devices monolithic to the sole, or multilayer soles, with a part of it in contact with the ground, but excluding the cleats, and studs attached to the sole, like for football or soccer boots or shoes which have this group dedicated: A43C15/16 and subgroups.
A43C15/00 and especially A43C15/16, dedicated to studs and cleats.

definition-item.definition-title: characterised by their attachment, also attachment of combined soles and heels

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Easily-exchangeable soles (protecting-soles A43C13/12)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

definition-item.definition-title: Welts for footwear

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
The welt that is used when assembling, mainly by stitching the sole to the upper.

definition-item.definition-title: Insoles for insertion, e.g. footbeds or inlays, for attachment to the shoe after the upper has been joined

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Insoles to be inserted.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:
Inserted insole with cushion/pads are also to be classified in A43B7/1405.
In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Insole to be put in a shoe as to make it fit better.

definition-item.definition-title: Shoe-shaped inserts; Inserts covering the instep

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Linings, paddings, insertions for ski boots; Inner boots for ski boots

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Insoles for insertion, e.g. footbeds or inlays, for attachment to the shoe after the upper has been joined

definition-item.definition-title: Heels; Top-pieces or top-lifts

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Heels of the type protruding from the sole, like high heels for women or some leather classical shoes for men with a heel attached to a sole.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Pneumatic soles filled with compressible fluid, e.g. air or gas

definition-item.definition-title: Uppers; Boot legs; Stiffeners; Other single parts of footwear

section-body.paragraph-text: This place covers:
Shoe uppers, boot legs, toe and heel cups, linings, and anything that would be attached for decorating the upper.
Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

Even if slippers and sandals should be in the A43B3/10 and A43B3/12 and sub-groups, if the upper of the slipper has some very special feature which can be of interest for common shoes, it would be classified also in the A43B23/00.

definition-item.definition-title: Uppers; Boot legs

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Ski boots characterised by the material of the upper
Skating boots characterised by the upper

definition-item.definition-title: Linings therefor {(lining laminated with upper A43B23/026)}

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:
Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Linings, paddings, insertions for ski boot; Inner boots for ski boot

definition-item.definition-title: Heel stiffeners; Toe stiffeners

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

definition-item.definition-title: Supports for the shank or arch of the uppers

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

definition-item.definition-title: Heel-protectors for car-drivers

section-body.paragraph-text: Not used: A43B5/007 footwear for car drivers instead.
